official_title: To provide for the retirement of all $100 Federal Reserve notes and the replacement of such notes with new $100 Federal Reserve notes of a different design.
short_title: One Hundred Dollar Federal Reserve Note Redesign and Exchange Act of 1989

summary.text: $100 Federal Reserve Note Redesign and Exchange Act of 1989 - Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to retire all circulating Federal Reserve Notes in the denomination of $100 and to exchange them with newly issued, redesigned notes. Mandates that the name, address, and social security number of any holder who exchanges such notes in the value of $5,000 or more be forwarded by the Secretary to law enforcement agencies for use in criminal investigation or prosecution.

titles.title: One Hundred Dollar Federal Reserve Note Redesign and Exchange Act of 1989
To provide for the retirement of all $100 Federal Reserve notes and the replacement of such notes with new $100 Federal Reserve notes of a different design.
